Lack of credible sources: The expert mentions that the claim does not provide any evidence beyond crediting it to "sources say." There have been no credible media reports regarding Obama having talks with anyone involved in the Smollett case.
Denial from Obama: s spokesperson: Katie Hill, Obama’s spokesperson, explicitly denies the claim, calling it a "completely absurd" internet rumor.
Outdated image: The Facebook post includes an image of Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel leaning over to speak to Obama. However, a reverse image search reveals that the image is at least 10 years old, indicating that it is not related to the current situation.
Lack of national news coverage: The expert points out that it would be national news if a former president inserted himself in such a high-profile case. However, there is no evidence or credible media reports supporting this claim.
